One of the most intense talks ever given at TED. A woman who was raped by her boyfriend at age 16. And the man who raped her. Wow. #TEDWomen
“We have a global addition to “othering” each other” – Morley #TEDWomen

“Mothers aren’t just eating for 2. They’re eating for 2 to the trillions” – Katie Hinde on breast milk’s role in cultivating good bacteria

"I’m a recovering time debtor." - Linda Sivertson #TEDWomen (I aspire to this status...)
“Small moments have great power. You can use your bits of time to create bits of joy.” - Laura Vanderkam #TEDWomen
The key to time management is treating our priorities like a water heater that’s broken and must be fixed NOW -Laura Vanderkam #TEDWomen
"When you say 'I don’t have time' you mean 'It’s not a priority.' Time is a choice."  - Laura Vanderkam #TEDWomen
"We don’t build the lives we want by saving time. We build the lives we want. And then time saves itself” - Laura Vanderkam #TEDWomen
“I was once late to my own speech on time management.” - Laura Vanderkam #TEDWomen

“Time does not belong to us. We live at a pace of continual urgency.” – Brittney Cooper #TEDWomen
Tweeting today from #TEDWomen The opening question: Do we control time? Or does time control us?
